events.name: The Dying Soldier
events.text: A Rustborn warrior lies bleeding against a rusted hull. Their breathing is shallow, their eyes pleading. They clutch a satchel to their chest.

choices.result: You bandage their wounds with scraps from your own supplies. They press a small token into your hand before losing consciousness. 'The Tribes... will remember...'
You pry the satchel from their weakening grip. Inside: salvage credits and a worn photograph. Their eyes follow you as you leave.
Some battles aren't yours to fight. You move on, but their labored breathing echoes in your mind long after.

events.name: The Void Mirror
events.text: A pool of absolute darkness sits in a crater. Your reflection stares back—but it's holding a card you've never seen. The void whispers promises of power.

choices.result: Your hand passes through the surface like ice water. When you pull back, you're holding something that shouldn't exist. Power courses through you—and something else.
You drive your fist into the pool. Reality screams. The darkness explodes outward, cutting you deeply. When you look again, the pool is gone—but you swear you can still see it watching.
Some doors are better left closed. You retreat from the crater, but the image of your other self lingers in your mind.

events.name: Merchant Camp
events.text: A small caravan has set up camp among the ruins. The merchants eye you warily but gesture toward their wares. A cooking fire offers warmth and the smell of actual food.

choices.result: The merchants drive a hard bargain, but the food and medical supplies are worth it. You feel your strength returning.
You trade stories of the road—dangers spotted, safe routes found. The merchants seem grateful for the intel.
You nod politely and continue your journey. The merchants watch you go, already packing up to move themselves.

events.name: Ancient Terminal
events.text: An Architect terminal flickers to life as you approach. Corrupted data scrolls across the screen, but some information might still be salvageable.

choices.result: Knowledge floods your mind—fragments of the Architects' research. Your head pounds, but you understand things now that you didn't before.
You focus on tactical data. One of your techniques feels sharper, more refined. The Architects knew how to fight.
You smash the terminal and salvage its components. Better in your hands than someone else's.

events.name: Tribal Shrine
events.text: A Rustborn shrine stands amid the wreckage—offerings of scrap and oil arranged around a stylized Titan skull. The air feels heavy with old faith.

choices.result: You add your own tribute to the shrine. Whether it's superstition or something more, you feel... blessed. Stronger.
You kneel before the shrine. The Titan's empty eyes seem to watch you. When you rise, you feel protected—armored by faith or fortune.
Desperation wins over respect. You pocket the valuables and flee before anyone notices. The Titan skull seems to glare at your back.

events.name: Wounded Creature
events.text: A mutated beast lies trapped under debris, whimpering. It's clearly dangerous—but also clearly suffering. Its eyes hold an unsettling intelligence.

choices.result: You carefully lift the debris. The creature either snaps at you in fear or... nuzzles your hand before limping away.
A quick, clean end. You salvage what you can from the creature. Mercy and practicality aren't always at odds.
Not your problem. You walk away, trying to ignore the sounds behind you.

events.name: Abandoned Mech
events.text: A derelict war machine lies half-buried in rust. Its reactor still pulses faintly. Some systems might be salvageable—or explosive.

choices.result: You feel the ancient power merge with your own systems. Your reactor surges with new energy—and dangerous heat.
You strip the mech's protective layers. The materials integrate well with your own frame.
The refined fuel is worth a fortune. You carefully extract it and move on.

events.name: The Collector
events.text: A hooded figure blocks your path. 'I trade in memories,' they rasp. 'Give me a piece of your power, and I'll give you something... different.'

choices.result: The figure takes your card and it dissolves into mist. In exchange, something new materializes in your deck. Different. Powerful.
The collector touches your forehead. Your life force drains away, but forbidden knowledge fills its place.
'Perhaps another time,' they whisper. When you look back, they're gone.

events.name: Corrupted Cache
events.text: A pre-Fall supply cache lies open, its contents glowing with void energy. The supplies look intact—if dangerous. Tendrils of darkness curl from within.

choices.result: You grab it all. The void energy seeps into you, corrupting but also empowering. You feel changed.
You carefully extract the currency, avoiding the worst of the corruption. A small price for survival.
You burn the cache and everything in it. The corruption recedes, and you feel... cleaner.

events.name: Tribal Duel
events.text: A Rustborn warrior blocks your path. 'Outsider! Prove your worth or turn back!' Their followers watch from the shadows, waiting to see what you'll do.

choices.result: You face the warrior in single combat. Whether you win or lose, the Tribes respect your courage.
Money talks. The warrior accepts your offering and grants passage.
You let your reactor flare, heat shimmering in the air. The warrior backs down, but their eyes promise future reckoning.
You circle around through dangerous terrain. It costs you, but you avoid the confrontation.

events.name: Void Whispers
events.text: The air grows cold. A voice speaks from nowhere and everywhere: 'I can see your future. Would you like to see it too? All it costs is... a little piece of yourself.'

choices.result: Visions flood your mind—you see the path ahead clearly. But the voice doesn't leave. It's still there, whispering.
The void laughs. 'As you wish.' Power surges through you—terrible, wonderful power. And hunger.
You steel your mind against the whispers. They fade, screaming. For now.

events.name: Calm in the Storm
events.text: You find a protected alcove, safe from the rust winds. Time for a brief respite. How will you spend these precious moments?

choices.result: You close your eyes and let your body recover. The wounds aren't gone, but they hurt less.
You spend the time honing your techniques. One of your abilities feels sharper now.
You focus your mind, letting go of techniques that no longer serve you.

events.name: Scrap Gamble
events.text: A group of Rustborn have set up a gambling den in a ruined building. 'Care to test your luck, stranger?' The stakes are high, but so are the potential rewards.

choices.result: The dice tumble... You either double your money or lose it all.
High risk, high reward. Fortune favors the bold—or punishes the foolish.
They put you to work dealing with troublemakers. Tough work, but it pays.
Gambling is for those with credits to spare. You move on.

events.name: Echo of Self
events.text: You see yourself—another you, standing at a crossroads. They look tired, wounded, but determined. 'I know how this ends,' they say. 'Let me show you.'

choices.result: Your echo merges with you. Their memories flood your mind—a thousand possibilities, a thousand endings. The knowledge is overwhelming. And addictive.
You clash with yourself. Only one can exist. When it's over, you feel more... singular. More real.
'Then we'll meet again,' they say sadly. 'We always do.' You keep walking.
